intro: Cacalia grisea, commonly known as the gray thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage with spiny leaves and produces small, pinkish to purple flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Cacalia grisea is noted for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
